SEARCH
Package org.lwjgl.util.opus

Class OpusPictureTag

java.lang.Object
org.lwjgl.system.Pointer.Default
org.lwjgl.system.Struct
org.lwjgl.util.opus.OpusPictureTag
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable, NativeResource, Pointer
public class OpusPictureTag extends Struct implements NativeResource
The contents of a METADATA_BLOCK_PICTURE tag.

Layout


 struct OpusPictureTag {
     opus_int32 type();
     char * mime_type(int);
     char * description();
     opus_uint32 width();
     opus_uint32 height();
     opus_uint32 depth();
     opus_uint32 colors();
     opus_uint32 data_length();
     unsigned char * data();
     int format();
 }

  • Constructor Details

    • OpusPictureTag

      public OpusPictureTag(ByteBuffer container)
      Creates a OpusPictureTag instance at the current position of the specified ByteBuffer container. Changes to the buffer's content will be visible to the struct instance and vice versa.

      The created instance holds a strong reference to the container object.

  • Method Details

    • sizeof

      public int sizeof()
      Description copied from class: Struct
      Returns sizeof(struct).
      Specified by:
      sizeof in class Struct

    • type

      public int type()
      the picture type according to the ID3v2 APIC frame:
      1. Other
      2. 32x32 pixels 'file icon' (PNG only)
      3. Other file icon
      4. Cover (front)
      5. Cover (back)
      6. Leaflet page
      7. Media (e.g. label side of CD)
      8. Lead artist/lead performer/soloist
      9. Artist/performer
      10. Conductor
      11. Band/Orchestra
      12. Composer
      13. Lyricist/text writer
      14. Recording Location
      15. During recording
      16. During performance
      17. Movie/video screen capture
      18. A bright colored fish
      19. Illustration
      20. Band/artist logotype
      21. Publisher/Studio logotype

      Others are reserved and should not be used. There may only be one each of picture type 1 and 2 in a file.

    • mime_type

      public ByteBuffer mime_type(int capacity)
      Parameters:
      capacity - the number of elements in the returned buffer
      Returns:
      the MIME type of the picture, in printable ASCII characters 0x20-0x7E.

      The MIME type may also be "-->" to signify that the data part is a URL pointing to the picture instead of the picture data itself. In this case, a terminating NUL is appended to the URL string in #data, but #data_length is set to the length of the string excluding that terminating NUL.

    • description

      public ByteBuffer description()
      the description of the picture, in UTF-8

    • descriptionString

      public String descriptionString()
      the description of the picture, in UTF-8

    • width

      public int width()
      the width of the picture in pixels

    • height

      public int height()
      the height of the picture in pixels

    • depth

      public int depth()
      the color depth of the picture in bits-per-pixel ( not bits-per-channel)

    • colors

      public int colors()
      for indexed-color pictures (e.g., GIF), the number of colors used, or 0 for non-indexed pictures.

    • data_length

      public int data_length()
      the length of the picture data in bytes

    • data

      public ByteBuffer data()
      the binary picture data

    • format

      public int format()
      the format of the picture data, if known. One of:
      PIC_FORMAT_UNKNOWNPIC_FORMAT_URLPIC_FORMAT_JPEGPIC_FORMAT_PNGPIC_FORMAT_GIF

      public static OpusPictureTag malloc()
